about.description:
Welcome to wxPython's Project Phoenix! Phoenix is the improved next-generation
wxPython, "better, stronger, faster than he was before." This new
implementation is focused on improving speed, maintainability and
extensibility. Just like "Classic" wxPython, Phoenix wraps the wxWidgets C++
toolkit and provides access to the user interface portions of the wxWidgets
API, enabling Python applications to have a native GUI on Windows, Macs or
not win systems, with a native look and feel and requiring very little (if any)
platform specific code.
about.summary: Cross platform GUI toolkit for Python, "Phoenix" version

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "4.2.1" %}

package:
  name: wxpython
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.io/packages/source/w/wxPython/wxPython-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: e48de211a6606bf072ec3fa778771d6b746c00b7f4b970eb58728ddf56d13d5c
  patches:
    - patches/build.py.patch  # Make sure windows builds don't try to use msgfmt.
    - patches/0003-Don-t-enable-debug-info-for-all-builds.patch
    - patches/0004-enable-use-of-no_magic-and-install_wx-on-Windows.patch
    - patches/0005-MacOS-no-builtin-3rdparty.patch


build:
  number: 1
  osx_is_app: true  # [osx]
  missing_dso_whitelist:   # [osx]
    - /System/Library/Frameworks/QTKit.framework/Versions/A/QTKit  # [osx]

requirements:
  build:
    - python                                 # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - cross-python_{{ target_platform }}     # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - pkg-config                         # [not win]
    - gnuconfig                          # [unix]
    - make                               # [unix]
    - {{ compiler('c') }}
    - {{ compiler('cxx') }}
    - {{ cdt('gtk2-devel') }}            # [linux]
    - {{ cdt('libpng-devel') }}          # [linux]
    - {{ cdt('libxrender-devel') }}      # [linux]
    - {{ cdt('mesa-libgl-devel') }}      # [linux]
    - {{ cdt('mesa-dri-drivers') }}      # [linux]
    - {{ cdt('libXxf86vm-devel') }}      # [linux]
    - {{ cdt('libselinux') }}            # [linux]
    - {{ cdt('libdrm-devel') }}          # [linux]
    - {{ cdt('xorg-x11-proto-devel') }}  # [linux]
    - {{ cdt('libxau-devel') }}          # [linux]
    - {{ cdt('libx11-devel') }}          # [linux]
    - {{ cdt('libxfixes-devel') }}       # [linux]
    - {{ cdt('libxext-devel') }}         # [linux]
    - {{ cdt('libxinerama') }}           # [linux]
    - {{ cdt('libxi') }}                 # [linux]
    - {{ cdt('libxcb') }}                # [linux]
    - {{ cdt('libxcursor') }}            # [linux]
    - {{ cdt('libxcomposite') }}         # [linux]
    - {{ cdt('libxdamage-devel') }}      # [linux]
    - {{ cdt('webkitgtk-devel') }}       # [linux]
    - {{ cdt('libsoup-devel') }}         # [linux]
  host:
    - python
    - pip
    - attrdict3
    - cairo  # [linux]
    - cython >=0.29.32,<3
    - expat  # [not win]
    - gettext  # [not win]
    - glib  # [linux]
    - gst-plugins-base {{ gstreamer }}  # [linux]
    - gstreamer                         # [linux]
    - gtk2  # [linux]
    - libjpeg-turbo   # [not win]
    - libglu  # [linux]
    - libiconv  # [osx]
    - libpng  # [not win]
    - libtiff  # [not win]
    - libxml2  # [linux]
    - pango  # [linux]
    - pathlib2
    - pcre2  # [not win]
    - pthread-stubs
    - requests
    - setuptools
    - xz  # [not win]
    - zlib  # [not win]

  run:
    - python
    - cairo  # [linux]
    - expat  # [not win]
    - gettext  # [not win]
    - glib  # [linux]
    - gtk2  # [linux]
    - libjpeg-turbo   # [not win]
    - libglu  # [linux]
    - libiconv  # [osx]
    - libpng  # [not win]
    - libtiff  # [not win]
    - libxml2  # [linux]
    - numpy
    - pango  # [linux]
    - pathlib2
    - pcre2  # [not win]
    - pillow
    - pthread-stubs
    - pypubsub  # [py3k]
    - python.app  # [osx]
    - requests
    - setuptools
    - six
    - xz  # [not win]
    - zlib  # [not win]


test:
  imports:
    - wx
    - wx.lib.pubsub  # [py3k]

about:
  home: https://wxpython.org/
  license: LGPL-2.0-or-later WITH WxWindows-exception-3.1
  license_family: LGPL
  license_file: LICENSE.txt
  summary: Cross platform GUI toolkit for Python, "Phoenix" version
  description: |
    Welcome to wxPython's Project Phoenix! Phoenix is the improved next-generation
    wxPython, "better, stronger, faster than he was before." This new
    implementation is focused on improving speed, maintainability and
    extensibility. Just like "Classic" wxPython, Phoenix wraps the wxWidgets C++
    toolkit and provides access to the user interface portions of the wxWidgets
    API, enabling Python applications to have a native GUI on Windows, Macs or
    not win systems, with a native look and feel and requiring very little (if any)
    platform specific code.
  doc_url: https://docs.wxpython.org/
  dev_url: https://github.com/wxWidgets/Phoenix

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - ocefpaf
    - constantinpape
    - timsnyder

about.description:
Welcome to wxPython's Project Phoenix! Phoenix is the improved next-generation
wxPython, "better, stronger, faster than he was before." This new
implementation is focused on improving speed, maintainability and
extensibility. Just like "Classic" wxPython, Phoenix wraps the wxWidgets C++
toolkit and provides access to the user interface portions of the wxWidgets
API, enabling Python applications to have a native GUI on Windows, Macs or
not win systems, with a native look and feel and requiring very little (if any)
platform specific code.
about.summary: Cross platform GUI toolkit for Python, "Phoenix" version
